isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - CATERPILLAR 3176B/3406E ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - 1994 - TROUBLESHOOTING - "RED" ENGINE WARNING LIGHT

note.para: NOTE: If the customer selectable Engine Protection system is turned OFF, the "Red" Engine Warning Light does not function.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to paragraphs Red Engine Warning Light for description of circuit operation.

para.emph: Before beginning this test procedure, inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires etc. (Refer to paragraph Visual Inspection Inspecting Connectors.)

svcsubproc.title: Testing "Red" Engine Warning Light - Stays ON or Comes ON Intermittently
svcsubproc.para: Refer to paragraph Red Engine Warning Light for lamp circuit operation. This test should be performed if this light stays ON or comes ON intermittently.

step1.para: Refer to Caterpillar Diagnostics manual and check for diagnostic codes associated with Engine Monitoring. Correct conditions causing codes before proceeding with this test.
Verify proper engine oil pressure and cooling levels.
